attributes.title: Get Out of Your Insecurity
attributes.description:
TALKS FROM MORNING SATSANG ON JULY 16 2012 IN Kodailanal, INDIA

In today's morning satsang, Paramahamsa Nithyananda (Swamji) takes questions from devotees. One questioner asks whether it is possible for the human body to contain the frequency of  enlightenment , and states that he is willing to risk death to become enlightened. Paramahamsa answers that the primary obstacle to achieving enlightenment is our fear of death. Once we decide that we are willing to die for the sake of an experience, death loses its power over us. We become strong enough to hold the energy of awakened kundalini within our nervous system. We achieve the yogic body required to support the Vedic mind of an enlightened being.  
So long as we are weakened by dread, our nervous system cannot raise us to the zone of super-consciousness. Only by surrendering to the depths of our terror do we transcend the threat of our mortality . Then we discover our ability to radiate enlightenment.
